text: Henry Conner (born April 1, 1837) was a member of the Wisconsin State Senate. ==Biography== Conner was born on April 1, 1837 in West Chester, Pennsylvania. During the American Civil War, he served in the Union Army, achieving the rank of captain. Afterwards, he moved to Viroqua, Wisconsin. ==Political career== Conner was elected to the Senate in 1890. Previously, he was a commissioner of Philadelphia, Pennsylvania from 1867 to 1870. ==Personal life== In 1857, Conner married Amanda M. Bransby of Philadelphia, with whom he had three children, Mary, John, and Henry, of whom only Mary survived her father. Amanda Conner died in 1908, after an illness."Mrs. Henry Conner Dies at Hillsboro", The La Crosse Tribune (January 28, 1908), p. 1. Conner was still living as of 1916, when he was noted to be traveling from Viroqua to Hillsboro."Local and Personal", The La Crosse Tribune (November 17, 1916), p. 10. ==References== Category:People from West Chester, Pennsylvania Category:Politicians from Philadelphia Category:People from Viroqua, Wisconsin Category:Wisconsin state senators Category:Wisconsin Democrats Category:Pennsylvania Democrats Category:Union Army officers Category:1837 births Category:Year of death missing
title: Henry Conner
